name: Caribbean Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was OK. Service was a bit off-hand. Breakfast was expensive. The bad bit was discovering we had to climb two flights of narrow stairs with our heavy bags. We were told there were no other rooms available, although the place seemed almost deserted. Our room was on the front, which was OK, although opposite the pub (thankfully rather quiet on the weekday night we were there). We tried the 'restaurant strip' across the road - it's really in the middle of nowhere, but with a long strip of tiny restaurants offering Chinese, Indian, Italian, you name it. We tried the Thai one and ordered their 'special' mussels - they took an age to come, and when we asked were told 'they are being steamed to infuse all the flavours', but actually they were being drastically overcooked and arrived as rubber, which we sent back and ended up eating nothing! So overall our one-night experience of Coff's Harbour and the Caribbean Motel was pretty disappointing, and we won't be going back.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best value for money on our entire trip. We stayed in 6 different places. Rooms were very large and conveniently located to the restaurant strip across the road. Off street parking available. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location with generous rooms and facilities.

reviews.text: The pub accross the road rocks on until very late and is noisy, I had room 21 which was a smallish 2 br at the back. It was quiet in this room
reviews.title: Nice spot away from the traffic

reviews.text: I have stayed here before and rooms at the front can be noisy
reviews.title: Excellent value for money - great location

reviews.text: However i would recommend this hotel as one of the best in Coffs for its price
reviews.title: Even better than last time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read some of the review for places in Coffs, I was genuinely concerned about where to stay and decided to have a look at a few places, rather than book something online and therefore unseen. We decided to stop in at the Caribbean Motel and were surprised to find this nice little family-run place with reasonable prices, internet, new flat screen tv’s, nice toiletries, clean towels, a little pool and off-street parking.
reviews.title: Great little place for stopping by in Coffs Harbour

description: The AAA rated 3.5 star Caribbean Motel is ideally located in the Jetty area, with numerous restaurants across the road and the Jetty beach a few minutes walk away. Buffet or room service breakfast is available. The motel is a couple of minutes walk from the train station or a 5 minute cab ride from the airport. Reception is open 7am until 9pm, late check in can be arranged.
